title: Grilled Swordfish Steaks with Cucumber Sauce

instructions.1: Preheat an outdoor grill for medium-high heat, and lightly oil the grate.
instructions.2: Stir the cucumber, sour cream, lemon juice, and lemon zest in a small bowl until combined. Season to taste with salt, and refrigerate until ready to serve. Heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Stir in the onion and garlic; cook and stir until the onion has softened and turned translucent, about 5 minutes. Pour in the chili sauce, vinegar, and Worcestershire sauce. Bring to a simmer and cook 5 minutes to blend the flavors. Season with black pepper, and remove from the heat.
instructions.3: Brush the swordfish steaks on all sides with the 2 teaspoons of olive oil. Cook on the preheated grill until the fish is no longer translucent in the center, and easily flakes with a fork, about 3 minutes per side. Baste with the chili sauce while grilling. Serve the swordfish with lemon slices and the cucumber sauce.

questions.question: In Step 3, is the cucumber from Step 2 being used?
Is grill from Step 1 used in multiple future steps without being redefined?
Is cucumber from Step 2 used in multiple future steps without being redefined?
Is grill from Step 1 still available in Step 2?
Is black pepper live after Step 2?
What is the last time interval specified in Step 2?

Can we stir (Step 2) and brush (Step 3) at the same time?
